data.title: Players we'd like to see in EA Sports' 'CFB 25'
data.meta_description: Which NFL players do you want to see in EA Sports' College Football 25? Here are our picks, including Drake Maye and Jayden Daniels.
data.text:
After much anticipation, football fans and gamers will finally be able to get their hands on EA Sports College Football 25, which goes into early access on Monday, July 15, and has a full release scheduled for Friday, July 19.

For those wondering how to get early access, there are three ways: if you purchased the deluxe edition of EA Sports College Football 25, bought the MVP bundle with Madden 25, or signed up for EA play, which will give you a 10-hour trial.

If you’ve done any of those things, you can begin playing at 4 p.m. EDT on Monday, July 15.

The highly-anticipated game will incoude an “Ultimate Team” mode that allows fans to add legends to their roster, including both retired and active NFL players.

Some legends such as Miami Hurricanes linebacker Ray Lewis and Louisville Cardinals quarterback Lamar Jackson have already been confirmed to be in the game.

So, what other college football legends could we see added to the game? Here’s one player from each NFL team we want to see.

Arizona Cardinals: Kyler Murray, Oklahoma

Atlanta Falcons: Kyle Pitts, Florida

Baltimore Ravens: Lamar Jackson, Louisville

Buffalo Bills: Josh Allen, Wyoming

Carolina Panthers: Bryce Young, Alabama

Chicago Bears: Caleb Williams, USC

Cincinnati Bengals: Ja’Marr Chase, LSU

Cleveland Browns: Myles Garrett, Texas A&M

Dallas Cowboys: CeeDee Lamb, Oklahoma

Denver Broncos: Patrick Surtain II, Alabama

Detroit Lions: Jahmyr Gibbs, Alabama

Green Bay Packers: Jordan Love, Utah State

Houston Texans: Will Anderson Jr., Alabama

Indianapolis Colts: Anthony Richardson, Florida

Jacksonville Jaguars: Trevor Lawrence, Clemson

Kansas City Chiefs: Patrick Mahomes, Texas Tech

Las Vegas Raiders: Maxx Crosby, Eastern Michigan

Los Angeles Chargers: Blake Corum, Michigan

Los Angeles Rams: Cooper Kupp, Eastern Washington

Miami Dolphins: Tyreek Hill, Oklahoma State

Minnesota Vikings: Justin Jefferson, LSU

New England Patriots: Drake Maye, North Carolina

New Orleans Saints: Chris Olave, Ohio State

New York Giants: Dexter Lawrence, Clemson

New York Jets: Sauce Gardner, Cincinnati

Philadelphia Eagles: Devonta Smith, Alabama

Pittsburgh Steelers: T.J. Watt, Wisconsin

San Francisco 49ers: Nick Bosa, Ohio State

Seattle Seahawks: D.K. Metcalf, Ole Miss

Tampa Bay Buccaneers: Baker Mayfield, Oklahoma

Tennessee Titans: DeAndre Hopkins, Clemson

Washington Commanders: Jayden Daniels, LSU
